data.title: Pink Color Meaning: How to Say Love, Peace, Goodness
data.meta_description: Want to learn pink color meaning? It's often seen as a feminine color, but there’s a lot more to pink than that! Find out what different pinks symbolize.
data.text:
Wondering about the pink color meaning?

Pink is often seen as a feminine color, one for girls. But there’s a lot more to pink than that!

Pink is a complex color that has different meanings, along with its interesting tints and shades.

Let’s take a look!

Meaning of the Color Pink

Pink is a gentle color, and is often seen as the color of love and romance.

It is also associated with femininity. Girls’ toys often use pink tints and shades.

Pink is also useful as a calming color.

But there are also negative associations with this soft color, so read on!

How the Color Pink Affects You

Goodness and kindness

As well as being the color of love and romance, pink also symbolizes kindness and understanding.

For some people, it’s a positive and upbeat color that relates to all that’s good in the world.

Pink isn’t intimidating or threatening, but often has the opposite effect.

Love and romance

Pink is a little complicated when it comes to love and romance. The color is associated with love of all kinds, and is sometimes seen as a color of childlike wonder.

But it’s also a color of romance and passion! That comes from the red undertones in the color. But it symbolizes love in a more gentle way than aggressive reds.

When it comes to pink color meaning for Valentine’s Day, it’s seen as the color of the hopeless romantic.

Lifts the spirits

Pink is also said to lift the spirits and help people feel more hopeful. The color is upbeat and optimistic, and can help people feel this way too.

For some, it is said to help ease rage and aggression, to boost good cheer.

In interior design, pink walls help relieve anger and other negative feelings, bringing a positive and peaceful feeling to the room. Some prisons and police stations use this psychological effect to their advantage by confining aggressive people to a pink room or cell!

Psychologists say it can calm angry feelings in as little as 15 minutes.

Negative Connotations of the Color Pink

There are fewer negative associations of pink than with other colors.

One negative is that pink lacks confidence and can be timid. This hue often blends into the background, and for some people, heightens their self-doubt.

The other slightly negative association is with an unwillingness to take things seriously, to be silly.

Its connection with inexperience also includes weakness and timidity.

What do famous people say about pink? Check out these pink quotes!

Pink Meanings Around the World

In many Asian countries, pink is also seen as a feminine color, and connected with marriage. In Korea, it is also the color of trust.

China didn’t recognize the color for many years, but due to Western influences, now welcomes it.

In Latin American, it’s a popular color for buildings and is used in architecture.

In Switzerland, the calming effects of pink are used in prisons, with cell walls being painted pink.

Pink Color Meaning for Personality

People whose favorite color is pink are usually easygoing and approachable.

They tend to see the best in things and people, and cope well with small social groups.

They love to see others succeed, and enjoy the happiness of others.

Color Pink Meaning in the Bible

Pink doesn’t feature heavily in the Bible, but there are three main associations.

The first is with new life, and the second is with the Father’s heavenly care.

The third is with the Rose of Sharon. This biblical flower isn’t what we refer to today as a rose, but was likely more like a crocus or tulip. It probably grew in a fertile valley known as the Plain of Sharon, between the mountains of central Israel and the Mediterranean Sea.

Pink is also rarely used in the Catholic church. It’s a deeper shade of pink called rose.

Rose symbolizes a time of joy during a period of penance and prayer, such as Advent and Lent.

Other Spiritual Meanings and Symbolism of Pink

Pink is said to represent the inner child, and being in touch with it.

It’s also said to be connected with opening of your heart, or inviting romance into your life.

Together pink and blue color meanings lead to serenity, and sometimes idle pastimes like daydreaming.

Pink dream color meaning normally focuses on love or romance. For some, it also relates to their relationship with God.

Similarly, the pink aura meaning relates to a sensitive soul who values love and art.

Traditionally, pink isn’t one of the chakra colors.

Pink Meaning in Art & Design

Because pink doesn’t appear in nature that often, artists and designers didn’t use it regularly. There was no color named pink in English until the 17th century!

Renaissance artists were the first to use it as a defined part of their palette. However, it was mainly used for the flesh color of faces and hands.

It then grew into the associations with love and romance, and was popular with everything from Japanese-inspired art to the lilies of Claude Monet.

After that time, it went in and out of fashion until the 1990s, when it became a driving force in contemporary art.

Pink with white can symbolize childhood, innocence and tenderness, but pink with black or purple can be the color of seduction.

Tints and Shades of Pink Meanings

The color called Pink in CSS code has a hexidecimal code of #FFC0CB and RGB value of 255, 192, 203.

Pink Color Swatch

But there are many more shades of pink, each with their own twist on color meaning!

Rose pink is known as the color of love. This is why the pink color rose meaning is a romantic one.

It is a stronger pink shade with a hex code of #ff66cc and RGB of 255, 102, 204.

Rose Pink Color Swatch

Hot pink is another strong pink, seen as playful, sensual, and passionate. It is a color of warmth and joy, of a love for life.

The hex code is #ff69b4 and the RGB 255, 105, 180.

Hot Pink Color Swatch

Skin color is a light, brownish pink that’s associated with Caucasian skin. It sometimes implies sensual and sexual connotations. For others, it lacks passion and energy, and is a bit blah.

The hex code is #e2b8b4 and the RGB 226, 184, 180.

“Skin Color” Color Swatch

Salmon pink is a pink with a touch of orange. It’s a color of hope, health, and happiness.

The hex code for the shade is #fa8072 and the RGB is 250, 128, 114.

Salmon Pink Color Swatch

More pink color codes.

And this color thesaurus has even more color names for pink.

Phrases with Pink

There are lots of phrases and idioms that use pink in them, often relating to the traditional connections with the color. Some famous ones include:

Tickled pink – to be very pleased, happy.

In the pink – to be healthy.

Pink collar – jobs once traditionally held by women, such as secretaries or sales clerks.

Pink elephant – hallucinations when you are intoxicated.

Pinkie finger – the smallest finger on the hand.

Pink slip – a notice to tell you employment is ending. A definite negative!

How to Use Pink in Marketing

Pink has traditionally been used to market to female audiences. This comes from the use of pink clothing to signify a baby is a girl.

It also means many women’s products use pink colors, such as cosmetics and underwear.

Pink is also associated with breast cancer awareness and their pink ribbon.

However, the meaning of pink is expanding, so more businesses now use it in unexpected ways. Companies that are in industries that usually see a lot of blue in their branding are often choosing pink to contrast.

An example is Lyft, the ride-share company. They went with pink to stand out against competitors like Uber who tended towards traditional blue shades.

Grab more tips on business colors and find the right shades for your branding.

Feeling Happy with Pink

Whether you love it or hate it, pink has some clear color meanings and associations.

It is a romantic color that evokes calming feelings in some, and love in others.

It can work well in anything from interior design and fashion to artwork and branding. It all depends on the shade, and other colors used with it!
